message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.CC. 

The paper discusses the efficiency of games, which is a topic in game theory (cs.GT). The approach presented is based on linear programming duality, which is a technique used in optimization and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also mentions the similarity of the price of anarchy to measures such as approximation and competitive ratios, which are concepts in theoretical computer science (cs.LG). The paper discusses the applicability of the approach to a wide variety of games and environments, which suggests a focus on general methods rather than specific applications, placing it in the category of information theory (cs.IT) or computational complexity (cs.CC).
